# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is the Julia code for your problem:

```julia
function wrap_string(s::String, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(s, " ")
    result = ""
    line = ""
    
    for word in words
        if length(line * " " * word) > text_width
            result *= "\n" * line
            line = ""
        end
        
        line *= word * " "
    end
    
    result *= "\n" * line # Add the last line
    
    return result
end
```

You can use this function as follows:

```julia
s = "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Nunc lobortis metus in nulla ultricies, et fermentum sapien mollis."
println(wrap_string(s))
```

This will print:

```julia
Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet,
consectetur adipiscing elit. Nunc lobortis metus in nulla ultricies, et fermentum sapien mollis.
```
